name: George Tscherny
biography:
Born July 12, 1924, Budapest, Hungary.
Grew up in Berlin, Germany.
1941  Emigrated to the U. S. 
Served in the U. S. Army in World War II.
Studied graphic design at the Newark School of Fine and Insutrial Art.
Attended Pratt Institute, Brooklyn, New York.
1950-- Packaging designer, Donald Deskey & Associates.
1953-- George Nelson & Associates.
1955  Opened his own office. Clients have included The Ford Foundation, W.R. Grace & Co., and Texasgulf Inc.
Taught at the Visual School of Arts.
Awards: 1988  Medalist, American Institute of Graphic Arts.
              1997  Art Directors Hall of Fame.

Sources: www.adcny.org and aiga.org
